function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased usage of mobile applications may lead to prolonged screen time, contributing to sedentary behaviors and potential health issues.","Impact":"Increased risk of sedentary behavior-related health issues such as obesity, eye strain, and musculoskeletal problems.","Mitigation":"Encouraging regular breaks, promoting physical activity, and incorporating mindfulness features in mobile apps.","Technologies":"Activity tracking, reminder features, and mindfulness apps.","People":"Users of mobile applications, especially those prone to excessive screen time.","Owner":"App developers, health organizations, and employers."},{"Description":"Poorly designed or maintained mobile health (M-health) applications may lead to inaccurate health information, misdiagnosis, and ineffective treatment.","Impact":"Potential harm to users' health, delayed or inappropriate treatment, and compromised healthcare services.","Mitigation":"Establishing strict regulatory standards, conducting regular quality assessments, and providing clear user guidelines.","Technologies":"Health data encryption, data verification algorithms, and telehealth platforms.","People":"Users of M-health apps, healthcare providers, and regulatory authorities.","Owner":"App developers, healthcare organizations, and regulatory agencies."},{"Description":"Inadequate data privacy and security measures in mobile applications may result in unauthorized access to personal health information and potential data breaches.","Impact":"Risk of identity theft, exposure of sensitive health data, and compromised privacy and confidentiality.","Mitigation":"Implementing robust encryption, secure authentication methods, and regular security audits.","Technologies":"End-to-end encryption, biometric authentication, and secure cloud storage.","People":"Users of health-related apps, healthcare providers, and individuals with sensitive health information.","Owner":"App developers, cloud service providers, and regulatory authorities."}]}
